org.joone.util
Class ConverterPlugIn

java.lang.Object
  org.joone.util.ConverterPlugIn
All Implemented Interfaces:
InputPluginListener, java.io.Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
CenterOnZeroPlugIn, MinMaxExtractorPlugIn, MovingAveragePlugIn, NormalizerPlugIn, ShufflePlugin
public abstract class ConverterPlugIn
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable, InputPluginListener

This is the abstract class that must be extended to implement plugins for input data preprocessing. The objects extending this class can be inserted into objects that extend the org.joone.io.StreamInputSynapse.

Author:
Administrator
See Also:

Method Detail

convert

protected abstract void convert(int serie)
Applies the conversion on the Nth serie of the buffered pattern data. The method is abstract and should be overridden by the implementing class. Implementing classes can obtain the input patterns by calling the getInputVector method. The result is a Vector of Pattern objects which this method should use by converting the requested serie.

Parameters:
serie - int

convertPatterns

public void convertPatterns()
                     throws java.lang.NumberFormatException
Applies the conversion on the patterns contained in the InputVector and on the serie specifed by the call to org.joone.util.ConverterPlugIn.setAdvancedSerieSelector#setAdvancedSerieSelector.

Throws:
java.lang.NumberFormatException

getAdvancedSerieSelector

public java.lang.String getAdvancedSerieSelector()
Gets the AdvancedSerieSelector.

Returns:
Value of property AdvancedSerieSelector.

setAdvancedSerieSelector

public void setAdvancedSerieSelector(java.lang.String newSel)

Sets the AdvancedSerieSelector for this plugin.

The AdvancedSerieSelector instructs this ConverterPlugin what serie/columns it should process. The format of this specification is a comman seperated list of values and ranges. E.g '1,2,5,7' will instruct the converter to convert serie 1 and 2 and 5 and 7. A range can also be used e.g '2,4,5-8,9' will instruct the converter to process serie 2 and 4 and 5 and 7 and 8 and 9. A range is specifed using a '-' character with the number of the serie on either side.

Note NO negative numbers can be used in the AdvancedSerieSelector.

Parameters:
newSel - New value of the AdvancedSerieSelector.

addInputPluginListener

public void addInputPluginListener(InputPluginListener listener)
Adds an InputPlugInListener to this ConverterPlugIn. Typically this will be the next ConverterPlugIn in the series of cascading converters.

Parameters:
listener - The listener that requires notification of events from this ConverterPlugIn object.

removeInputPluginListener

public void removeInputPluginListener(InputPluginListener listener)
Removes an InputPlugInListener that was previously registered to receive converter plugin events.

Parameters:
listener - The listener that does not want to receive any more input plugin events from this ConverterPlugIn object.

fireDataChanged

protected void fireDataChanged()
Fires a data changed event in all InputPlugInListeners that are registered to receive events from this ConverterPlugIn object. This method calls the InputPlugInListener.dataChanged method in all registerd listeners.

getPluginListeners

protected java.util.Vector getPluginListeners()
Gets a vector of all the InputPlugInListeners that have been registerd to receive events from this ConverterPlugIn.

Returns:
The Vector of InputPlugInListeners listening to this ConverterPlugIn object.

check

public java.util.TreeSet check(java.util.TreeSet checks)
This method is called to preform a check on this converter's properties to ensure there are no errors or problems. If there is an error or problem with one of the properties then the issues are returned in a TreeSet.

Parameters:
checks - A TreeSet of issues that should be added to by this ConverterPlugIn.
Returns:
A TreeSet of errors or problems relating to the setup of this ConverterPlugIn object.
See Also:
Synapse
